_header: Sith that I absent am thus from you fare
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, ‘Slake my gret aduersite’, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 61) — three 8-line stanzas (ababbbbb) and 5-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
SYn that y absent am thus from yow fareGod wot madame how hit doth
                    me ennoy…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…And for my wille to gyue me sum partyForto aslake my gret
                    aduersite
BLHar682.Editions:
